PURPOSE OF THIS LETTER is to provide a bit of liaison between the pol-
icy level people in NAEB. I have long had the idea that something in-
between Newsletters was needed. My idea was general distribution to
memberso Ralph Steetle suggested that we start it out by having it
among this group. It looks like a good idea—-and herewith is the first
such. No regular publication date is planned. Issue will be when war-
ranted. You are free to compose your own and distribute it---or send it
your information to me and 1*11 include it in the next one.
NEW YORK TRIP. Your Executive Director started his tenure with a two

World Affairs Roundtable. This was the deal that Siegel mentioned at
the Allerton board meeting in June* Carnegie decided to make the parti®*
cipants Adult Education people rather than all radio--—although we
were well represented with Siegel, Ausmus and Miles. Preceding this was
an augmented Kellogg Executive committee meeting. Present were Siegel,
Ausmus, Paulu, Hull, Harley, Steetle, and Miles. Weill not attempt to
report in these memos the minutes of any meeting—leaving that to the
Secretary. We 'did settle matters of policy regarding the Kellogg grant.
Had reports from Steetle on JCET and Harley on Ford plus Hull on the
Ames grant and a general report on the TV surveys* Hull and I visited
